**Exercício 01**

::: {.callout-note title="Comentário — Fórmula-chave (Gamma)"}
Sempre que aparecer uma integral do tipo  
$$
\int_0^\infty x^k e^{-ax}\,dx, \quad a>0,
$$
podemos usar a identidade
$$
\int_0^\infty x^k e^{-ax}\,dx = \frac{\Gamma(k+1)}{a^{k+1}}, \quad a>0
$$
:::

(a) $\displaystyle \int_0^\infty x^2 e^{-3x}\,dx$

**Passo 1 — Identificar parâmetros**  
Aqui $k=2$ e $a=3$

**Passo 2 — Aplicar a fórmula**
$$
\int_0^\infty x^2 e^{-3x}\,dx = \frac{\Gamma(3)}{3^3}
$$

**Passo 3 — Calcular $\Gamma(3)$**
$$
\Gamma(3)=2!=2
$$

**Conclusão**
$$
\boxed{\int_0^\infty x^2 e^{-3x}\,dx=\frac{2}{27}}
$$

---

(b) $\displaystyle \int_0^\infty x^4 e^{-x/5}\,dx$

**Passo 1 — Identificar parâmetros**  
Note que $e^{-x/5}=e^{-(1/5)x}$. Logo $k=4$ e $a=\frac{1}{5}$

**Passo 2 — Aplicar a fórmula**
$$
\int_0^\infty x^4 e^{-x/5}\,dx=\frac{\Gamma(5)}{(1/5)^5}
$$

**Passo 3 — Calcular $\Gamma(5)$**
$$
\Gamma(5)=4!=24
$$

**Conclusão**
$$
\boxed{
\int_0^\infty x^4 e^{-x/5}\,dx
=24\cdot 5^5
=24\cdot 3125
=75000
}
$$

::: {.callout-warning title="Atenção — erro comum"}
Não confunda o parâmetro $a$.  
Em $e^{-x/5}$, vale **$a=1/5$** (e não $5$)
:::

---

(c) $\displaystyle \int_0^\infty \sqrt{x}\,e^{-2x/3}\,dx$

**Passo 1 — Reescrever $\sqrt{x}$ como potência**  
$$
\sqrt{x}=x^{1/2}
$$
Logo $k=\frac12$ e $a=\frac23$.

**Passo 2 — Aplicar a fórmula**
$$
\int_0^\infty x^{1/2}e^{-(2/3)x}\,dx
=\frac{\Gamma(3/2)}{(2/3)^{3/2}}
$$

**Passo 3 — Calcular $\Gamma(3/2)$**  
Usando $\Gamma(x+1)=x\Gamma(x)$ e $\Gamma(1/2)=\sqrt{\pi}$:
$$
\Gamma\left(\frac32\right)
=\frac12\Gamma\left(\frac12\right)
=\frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}
$$

**Passo 4 — Simplificar $(2/3)^{-3/2}$**
$$
\frac{1}{(2/3)^{3/2}}=\left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^{3/2}
$$

**Conclusão**
$$
\boxed{
\int_0^\infty \sqrt{x}\,e^{-2x/3}\,dx
=\frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}\left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^{3/2}
=\frac{3\sqrt{3\pi}}{4\sqrt{2}}
}
$$

**Exercício 02**

::: {.callout-note title="Comentário — parametrização (taxa)"}
Neste gabarito, $\mathrm{Gamma}(\alpha,\lambda)$ usa **$\lambda$ como taxa** (rate):
$$
f_X(x)=\frac{\lambda^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}x^{\alpha-1}e^{-\lambda x},\quad x>0.
$$
:::

(a) Densidade $f_X(x)$

**Passo 1 — Substituir $\alpha=3$ e $\lambda=1/2$**
$$
f_X(x)=\frac{(1/2)^3}{\Gamma(3)}x^{3-1}e^{-(1/2)x}
=\frac{(1/2)^3}{\Gamma(3)}x^{2}e^{-x/2}
$$

**Passo 2 — Calcular $\Gamma(3)$**  
Como $\Gamma(3)=2!=2$, temos:
$$
f_X(x)=\frac{1/8}{2}x^2e^{-x/2}=\boxed{\frac{1}{16}x^2e^{-x/2}},\quad x>0
$$
---

(b) Função de distribuição $F_X(x)$

Para $\alpha$ inteiro, vale a forma fechada:
$$
F_X(x)=1-e^{-\lambda x}\sum_{k=0}^{\alpha-1}\frac{(\lambda x)^k}{k!},\quad x\ge 0
$$

**Substituindo $\alpha=3$ e $\lambda=1/2$:**
$$
\boxed{
F_X(x)=1-e^{-x/2}\left(1+\frac{x}{2}+\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{x}{2}\right)^2\right)
=1-e^{-x/2}\left(1+\frac{x}{2}+\frac{x^2}{8}\right)
},\quad x\ge 0
$$


---



(c) Verificação por derivação: $F'_X(x)=f_X(x)$

**Passo 1 — Escrever como produto**  
Defina
$$
g(x)=e^{-x/2},\qquad h(x)=1+\frac{x}{2}+\frac{x^2}{8},
$$
de modo que $F_X(x)=1-g(x)h(x)$

**Passo 2 — Derivar com regra do produto**
$$
F_X'(x)=-\left(g'(x)h(x)+g(x)h'(x)\right)
$$
Como
$$
g'(x)=-\frac{1}{2}e^{-x/2},\qquad h'(x)=\frac{1}{2}+\frac{x}{4},
$$
segue:
$$
F_X'(x)= -\left[-\frac{1}{2}e^{-x/2}\left(1+\frac{x}{2}+\frac{x^2}{8}\right)
+e^{-x/2}\left(\frac{1}{2}+\frac{x}{4}\right)\right]
$$

**Passo 3 — Colocar $e^{-x/2}$ em evidência e simplificar**
$$
F_X'(x)=e^{-x/2}\left[\frac12\left(1+\frac{x}{2}+\frac{x^2}{8}\right)-\left(\frac12+\frac{x}{4}\right)\right]
$$
Note que
$$
\frac12\left(1+\frac{x}{2}+\frac{x^2}{8}\right)=\frac12+\frac{x}{4}+\frac{x^2}{16},
$$
logo o colchete vira $\frac{x^2}{16}$

**Conclusão**
$$
\boxed{F_X'(x)=\frac{1}{16}x^2e^{-x/2}=f_X(x)}
$$

**Exercício 03** 

Dados: $E(X)=48$ e $DP(X)=24\Rightarrow \mathrm{Var}(X)=24^2=576$

Para $X\sim\mathrm{Gamma}(\alpha,\lambda)$ (taxa):
$$
E(X)=\frac{\alpha}{\lambda},\qquad \mathrm{Var}(X)=\frac{\alpha}{\lambda^2}
$$

(a) Identificar $(\alpha,\lambda)$

**Passo 1 — Encontrar $\lambda$**  
Da relação $\mathrm{Var}(X)=\alpha/\lambda^2$ e $E(X)=\alpha/\lambda$, obtemos:
$$
\lambda=\frac{E(X)}{\mathrm{Var}(X)}=\frac{48}{576}=\boxed{\frac{1}{12}}
$$

**Passo 2 — Encontrar $\alpha$**
$$
\alpha=E(X)\lambda=48\cdot\frac{1}{12}=\boxed{4}
$$

Logo,
$$
\boxed{X\sim\mathrm{Gamma}(4,1/12)}
$$

::: {.callout-note title="Comentário — sobrevivência para $\alpha$ inteiro"}
Se $\alpha$ é inteiro, então
$$
S(t)=P(X>t)=e^{-\lambda t}\sum_{k=0}^{\alpha-1}\frac{(\lambda t)^k}{k!}
$$
Aqui $\alpha=4$, então a soma vai até $k=3$.
:::



---



(b) Calcular $P(X>60)$

**Passo 1 — Calcular $\lambda t$**
$$
\lambda t=\frac{1}{12}\cdot 60=5
$$

**Passo 2 — Aplicar a fórmula de $S(t)$**
$$
P(X>60)=S(60)=e^{-5}\left(1+5+\frac{5^2}{2}+\frac{5^3}{6}\right)
=e^{-5}\left(1+5+\frac{25}{2}+\frac{125}{6}\right)
$$

**Passo 3 — Somar os termos**
$$
1+5+\frac{25}{2}+\frac{125}{6}
=\frac{6+30+75+125}{6}=\frac{236}{6}=\frac{118}{3}
$$

**Conclusão**
$$
\boxed{P(X>60)=\frac{118}{3}e^{-5}}
$$


---


(c) Calcular $P(X>60\mid X>40)$

::: {.callout-note title="Comentário — por que vira razão de sobrevivências?"}
Como $\{X>60\}\subset\{X>40\}$, então:
$$
P(X>60\mid X>40)=\frac{P(X>60)}{P(X>40)}=\frac{S(60)}{S(40)}
$$
:::

**Passo 1 — Calcular $S(40)$**  
Primeiro:
$$
\lambda t=\frac{1}{12}\cdot 40=\frac{10}{3}
$$
Então
$$
S(40)=e^{-10/3}\left(1+\frac{10}{3}+\frac{(10/3)^2}{2}+\frac{(10/3)^3}{6}\right)
$$
Agora:
$$
\frac{(10/3)^2}{2}=\frac{100/9}{2}=\frac{50}{9},\qquad
\frac{(10/3)^3}{6}=\frac{1000/27}{6}=\frac{500}{81}
$$
Logo:
$$
S(40)=e^{-10/3}\left(1+\frac{10}{3}+\frac{50}{9}+\frac{500}{81}\right)
$$
Em denominador $81$:
$$
1=\frac{81}{81},\ \ \frac{10}{3}=\frac{270}{81},\ \ \frac{50}{9}=\frac{450}{81},\ \ \frac{500}{81}=\frac{500}{81}
$$
Somando:
$$
\frac{81+270+450+500}{81}=\frac{1301}{81}
$$
Portanto:
$$
S(40)=\boxed{\frac{1301}{81}e^{-10/3}}
$$

**Passo 2 — Formar a razão $S(60)/S(40)$**
$$
\frac{S(60)}{S(40)}=
\frac{\frac{118}{3}e^{-5}}{\frac{1301}{81}e^{-10/3}}
=\frac{118}{3}\cdot\frac{81}{1301}\cdot e^{-5+10/3}
$$
Como $\frac{81}{3}=27$ e $-5+\frac{10}{3}=-\frac{5}{3}$:
$$
\boxed{P(X>60\mid X>40)=\frac{3186}{1301}e^{-5/3}}
$$


---


(d) Três sistemas iid: probabilidade de pelo menos 2 passarem 60 dias

Seja
$$
p=P(X>60)=\frac{118}{3}e^{-5}
$$
Se $N$ é o número (entre 3) que passam 60 dias, então $N\sim\mathrm{Bin}(3,p)$.

**Passo 1 — Escrever $P(N\ge 2)$**
$$
P(N\ge 2)=P(N=2)+P(N=3)
=\binom{3}{2}p^2(1-p)+p^3
$$

**Passo 2 — Simplificar**
$$
\binom{3}{2}p^2(1-p)+p^3
=3p^2-3p^3+p^3
=\boxed{3p^2-2p^3}
$$

**Exercício 04**

Compare com
$$
f(x)=\frac{\lambda^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}x^{\alpha-1}e^{-\lambda x}
$$

(a) $\frac{8}{3}x^3e^{-2x}$
O expoente de $x$ é $3$, então $\alpha-1=3\Rightarrow \alpha=4$  
O termo $e^{-2x}$ dá $\lambda=2$
$$
\boxed{\alpha=4,\ \lambda=2}
$$


---


(b) $\frac{1}{4}xe^{-x/2}$
Aqui $x^1$, então $\alpha-1=1\Rightarrow \alpha=2$  
E $e^{-x/2}$ dá $\lambda=1/2$
$$
\boxed{\alpha=2,\ \lambda=\frac12}
$$



---



(c) $\sqrt{\frac{3}{\pi x}}e^{-3x}$
Reescreva:
$$
\sqrt{\frac{3}{\pi x}}=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{\pi}}x^{-1/2}
$$
Logo $x^{\alpha-1}=x^{-1/2}\Rightarrow \alpha-1=-1/2\Rightarrow \alpha=1/2$, e $e^{-3x}$ dá $\lambda=3$:
$$
\boxed{\alpha=\frac12,\ \lambda=3}
$$

**Exercício 05** 

::: {.callout-note title="Comentário — relação Beta–Gamma"}
$$
B(a,b)=\frac{\Gamma(a)\Gamma(b)}{\Gamma(a+b)},\qquad \Gamma\left(\frac12\right)=\sqrt{\pi}
$$
:::



(a) $B(2,3)$
$$
B(2,3)=\frac{\Gamma(2)\Gamma(3)}{\Gamma(5)}=\frac{1!\,2!}{4!}=\boxed{\frac{1}{12}}
$$

---


(b) $B(3,1)$
$$
B(3,1)=\frac{\Gamma(3)\Gamma(1)}{\Gamma(4)}=\frac{2!\,1}{3!}=\boxed{\frac{1}{3}}
$$


---


(c) $B\left(\frac12,4\right)$
Usando $\Gamma(4)=3!=6$ e $\Gamma(9/2)=\frac{7}{2}\frac{5}{2}\frac{3}{2}\frac{1}{2}\Gamma(1/2)=\frac{105}{16}\sqrt{\pi}$:
$$
B\left(\frac12,4\right)
=\frac{\Gamma(1/2)\Gamma(4)}{\Gamma(9/2)}
=\frac{\sqrt{\pi}\cdot 6}{(105/16)\sqrt{\pi}}
=\boxed{\frac{32}{35}}
$$


---


(d) $B\left(\frac32,\frac12\right)$
Como $\Gamma(3/2)=\frac12\sqrt{\pi}$ e $\Gamma(2)=1! =1$:
$$
B\left(\frac32,\frac12\right)
=\frac{\Gamma(3/2)\Gamma(1/2)}{\Gamma(2)}
=\frac{\left(\frac12\sqrt{\pi}\right)\sqrt{\pi}}{1}
=\boxed{\frac{\pi}{2}}
$$


---


**Exercício 06**

A densidade da Beta é
$$
f(x)=\frac{1}{B(a,b)}x^{a-1}(1-x)^{b-1},\quad 0<x<1
$$

(a) Densidade

Como $B(2,3)=1/12$,
$$
\boxed{f(x)=12x(1-x)^2,\quad 0<x<1}
$$


---



(b) Função de distribuição $F(x)$

**Passo 1 — Expandir o integrando**
$$
12x(1-x)^2=12x(1-2x+x^2)=12x-24x^2+12x^3
$$

**Passo 2 — Integrar de 0 até $x$**
$$
F(x)=\int_0^x (12t-24t^2+12t^3)\,dt
=\left(6t^2-8t^3+3t^4\right)\Big|_{0}^{x}
$$

**Conclusão**
$$
\boxed{F(x)=6x^2-8x^3+3x^4,\quad 0\le x\le 1}
$$


---



(c) Esperança

Para $X\sim\mathrm{Beta}(a,b)$:
$$
\boxed{E(X)=\frac{a}{a+b}}
$$
Logo,
$$
\boxed{E(X)=\frac{2}{5}=0,4}
$$


---



(d) Variância

Para $X\sim\mathrm{Beta}(a,b)$:
$$
\boxed{\mathrm{Var}(X)=\frac{ab}{(a+b)^2(a+b+1)}}
$$
Logo,
$$
\mathrm{Var}(X)=\frac{2\cdot 3}{5^2\cdot 6}=\frac{6}{150}=\boxed{\frac{1}{25}}=0,04
$$


---


(e) Probabilidades

(i) $P(X\ge E(X))$

Como $E(X)=0,4$:
$$
P(X\ge E(X))=1-F(0,4)
$$
Calcule:
$$
F(0,4)=6(0,16)-8(0,064)+3(0,0256)=0,5248=\frac{328}{625}
$$
Logo:
$$
\boxed{P(X\ge E(X))=1-\frac{328}{625}=\frac{297}{625}}
$$


(ii) $P(X>E(X)\mid X<E(X)+DP(X))$

Aqui $DP(X)=\sqrt{0,04}=0,2$ e $E+DP=0,6$. Então:
$$
P(X>0,4\mid X<0,6)=\frac{P(0,4<X<0,6)}{P(X<0,6)}
=\frac{F(0,6)-F(0,4)}{F(0,6)}
$$
Calcule:
$$
F(0,6)=6(0,36)-8(0,216)+3(0,1296)=0,8208=\frac{513}{625}
$$
Portanto:
$$
\boxed{\frac{F(0,6)-F(0,4)}{F(0,6)}
=\frac{\frac{513}{625}-\frac{328}{625}}{\frac{513}{625}}
=\frac{185}{513}}
$$

**Exercício 07** 

Denote por $I_x(a,b)$ a Beta incompleta regularizada (a CDF da Beta).

(a) Média

Para Beta$(a,b)$:
$$
E(X)=\frac{a}{a+b}
$$
Logo:
$$
\boxed{E(X)=\frac{3/2}{3/2+3}=\frac{1}{3}}
$$


---



(b) Probabilidade de “fora do padrão”

Se
$$
A=\{X>0,5\}\cup\{X<0,1\},
$$
então:
$$
\boxed{
P(A)=P(X<0,1)+P(X>0,5)
=I_{0,1}\left(\frac32,3\right)+\left[1-I_{0,5}\left(\frac32,3\right)\right]
}
$$


---


(c) $P\left(X<\text{média}\mid A\right)$

A média é $1/3$ e, dentro do evento $A$, o único trecho abaixo de $1/3$ é $X<0,1$. Logo:
$$
P\left(X<\frac13\mid A\right)=\frac{P(X<0,1)}{P(A)}
$$
Assim:
$$
\boxed{
P\left(X<\frac13\mid A\right)=
\frac{I_{0.1}\left(\frac32,3\right)}{
I_{0.1}\left(\frac32,3\right)+1-I_{0.5}\left(\frac32,3\right)
}
}
$$


---



(d) Até encontrar 3 fora do padrão: média de “dentro do padrão”

Seja $p=P(A)$ a probabilidade de “fora do padrão”.  
O número esperado de observações “dentro do padrão” antes de ocorrerem 3 “fora do padrão” é:
$$
\boxed{E(\text{dentro})=\frac{3(1-p)}{p}},\quad p=P(A)
$$

**Exercício 09**

A Weibull (escala $\alpha$, forma $\beta$) tem:
$$
F(x)=1-e^{-(x/\alpha)^\beta},\quad x\ge 0,
$$
$$
f(x)=\frac{\beta}{\alpha}\left(\frac{x}{\alpha}\right)^{\beta-1}e^{-(x/\alpha)^\beta},\quad x>0
$$

(a) Densidade

Substituindo $\alpha=2$, $\beta=2$:
$$
f(x)=\frac{2}{2}\left(\frac{x}{2}\right)^{1}e^{-(x/2)^2}
=\boxed{\frac{x}{2}e^{-x^2/4}},\quad x>0
$$


---


(b) Distribuição
$$
\boxed{F(x)=1-e^{-x^2/4}},\quad x\ge 0
$$


---


(c) Esperança

Para Weibull:
$$
E(X)=\alpha\Gamma\left(1+\frac{1}{\beta}\right)
$$
Logo:
$$
E(X)=2\Gamma\left(\frac32\right)=2\cdot\frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}
=\boxed{\sqrt{\pi}}
$$

::: {.callout-warning title="Atenção — correção importante"}
$\Gamma(3/2)=\sqrt{\pi}/2$, portanto $2\Gamma(3/2)=\sqrt{\pi}$ (não $\pi$).
:::


---



(d) Variância

Para Weibull:
$$
\mathrm{Var}(X)=\alpha^2\left[\Gamma\left(1+\frac{2}{\beta}\right)-\Gamma^2\left(1+\frac{1}{\beta}\right)\right]
$$
Aqui:
$$
\mathrm{Var}(X)=4\left[\Gamma(2)-\Gamma^2\left(\frac32\right)\right]
=4\left[1-\left(\frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}\right)^2\right]
=\boxed{4-\pi}
$$



---


(e) Probabilidades

$$
P(X>1)=e^{-(1/2)^2}=\boxed{e^{-1/4}}
$$

E
$$
P(X>1\mid X<2)=\frac{P(1<X<2)}{P(X<2)}
=\frac{F(2)-F(1)}{F(2)}
=\boxed{\frac{e^{-1/4}-e^{-1}}{1-e^{-1}}}
$$

---



**Exercício 10** 

(a) Esperança
$$
\boxed{E(X)=\alpha\Gamma\left(1+\frac{1}{4}\right)=\frac12\,\Gamma\left(\frac54\right)}
$$


---


(b) Desvio-padrão

Primeiro:
$$
\mathrm{Var}(X)=\alpha^2\left[\Gamma\left(1+\frac{2}{4}\right)-\Gamma^2\left(1+\frac{1}{4}\right)\right]
=\frac14\left[\Gamma\left(\frac32\right)-\Gamma^2\left(\frac54\right)\right]
$$
Logo:
$$
\boxed{DP(X)=\frac12\sqrt{\Gamma(3/2)-\Gamma(5/4)^2}}
$$


---


(c) $P(X>10)$
$$
P(X>10)=\exp\left(-(10/0.5)^4\right)=\exp(-20^4)=\boxed{e^{-160000}}
$$


---


(d) $P(X>8\mid X>5)$
$$
P(X>8\mid X>5)=\frac{S(8)}{S(5)}
=\exp\left(-\left(\frac{8}{0.5}\right)^4+\left(\frac{5}{0.5}\right)^4\right)
=\exp(-(16^4-10^4))
=\boxed{e^{-55536}}
$$

---


(e) Percentil 90
Se $F(t)=0.9$, então $e^{-(t/\alpha)^\beta}=0.1$ e:
$$
(t/\alpha)^\beta=\ln 10
\quad\Rightarrow\quad
\boxed{t=\alpha(\ln 10)^{1/4}=\frac12(\ln 10)^{1/4}}
$$

**Exercício 11** 


(a) $\frac{3}{8}x^2e^{-x^3/8}$
Como o expoente no termo exponencial é $x^3/8$, temos $\beta=3$ e $\alpha^3=8\Rightarrow \alpha=2$:
$$
\boxed{(\alpha,\beta)=(2,3)}
$$

---


(b) Caso do tipo $f(x)=\frac{1}{4}x^{-1/2}e^{-\sqrt{x}/2}$
Se o expoente é $-(x/\alpha)^{1/2}=-\sqrt{x}/2$, então $\sqrt{x/\alpha}=\sqrt{x}/2\Rightarrow \alpha=4$ e $\beta=1/2$:
$$
\boxed{(\alpha,\beta)=\left(4,\frac12\right)}
$$

---


(c) $18xe^{-9x^2}$
Como o expoente é $-9x^2$, temos $\beta=2$ e $(x/\alpha)^2=9x^2\Rightarrow 1/\alpha^2=9\Rightarrow \alpha=1/3$:
$$
\boxed{(\alpha,\beta)=\left(\frac13,2\right)}
$$

**Exercício 12** 

Considere
$$
f(x)=\frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}(x-a)^{\alpha-1}e^{-\beta(x-a)}\mathbf{1}_{(a,\infty)}(x)
$$

**Passo 1 — Integrar em $\mathbb{R}$ (só conta $x>a$)**
$$
\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}f(x)\,dx=\int_a^\infty f(x)\,dx
$$

**Passo 2 — Substituição $u=x-a$**
$$
\int_a^\infty f(x)\,dx=\frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\int_0^\infty u^{\alpha-1}e^{-\beta u}\,du
$$

**Passo 3 — Substituição $v=\beta u$**
Se $v=\beta u$, então $du=dv/\beta$ e:
$$
\frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\int_0^\infty \left(\frac{v}{\beta}\right)^{\alpha-1}e^{-v}\frac{dv}{\beta}
=\frac{1}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\int_0^\infty v^{\alpha-1}e^{-v}\,dv
=\frac{\Gamma(\alpha)}{\Gamma(\alpha)}=1
$$

**Conclusão**
$$
\boxed{\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}f(x)\,dx=1}
$$

**Exercício 14** 

Se $X\sim\mathrm{Gamma}(\alpha,\lambda)$ (taxa), então:
$$
E(X)=\int_0^\infty x\frac{\lambda^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}x^{\alpha-1}e^{-\lambda x}\,dx
=\frac{\lambda^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\int_0^\infty x^{\alpha}e^{-\lambda x}\,dx
$$
Pela identidade:
$$
\int_0^\infty x^{\alpha}e^{-\lambda x}\,dx=\frac{\Gamma(\alpha+1)}{\lambda^{\alpha+1}}
$$
Logo:
$$
E(X)=\frac{\lambda^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\cdot\frac{\Gamma(\alpha+1)}{\lambda^{\alpha+1}}
=\frac{\alpha}{\lambda}
$$

Agora:
$$
E(X^2)=\frac{\lambda^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\int_0^\infty x^{\alpha+1}e^{-\lambda x}\,dx
=\frac{\lambda^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\cdot\frac{\Gamma(\alpha+2)}{\lambda^{\alpha+2}}
=\frac{\alpha(\alpha+1)}{\lambda^2}
$$
Então:
$$
\mathrm{Var}(X)=E(X^2)-E(X)^2
=\frac{\alpha(\alpha+1)}{\lambda^2}-\frac{\alpha^2}{\lambda^2}
=\boxed{\frac{\alpha}{\lambda^2}}
$$

**Exercício 15**

Se $X\sim\mathrm{Beta}(a,b)$:
$$
E(X)=\int_0^1 x\frac{1}{B(a,b)}x^{a-1}(1-x)^{b-1}\,dx
=\frac{1}{B(a,b)}\int_0^1 x^{a}(1-x)^{b-1}\,dx
=\frac{B(a+1,b)}{B(a,b)}
$$
Usando $B(a,b)=\frac{\Gamma(a)\Gamma(b)}{\Gamma(a+b)}$:
$$
E(X)=\frac{\Gamma(a+1)\Gamma(b)\Gamma(a+b)}{\Gamma(a)\Gamma(b)\Gamma(a+b+1)}
=\boxed{\frac{a}{a+b}}
$$

Além disso:
$$
E(X^2)=\frac{B(a+2,b)}{B(a,b)}
=\frac{a(a+1)}{(a+b)(a+b+1)}
$$
Logo:
$$
\mathrm{Var}(X)=E(X^2)-E(X)^2
=\boxed{\frac{ab}{(a+b)^2(a+b+1)}}
$$

**Exercício 16**

Se $X\sim\mathrm{Weibull}(\alpha,\beta)$, defina
$$
Y=\left(\frac{X}{\alpha}\right)^\beta
$$
Então $Y\sim\mathrm{Exp}(1)$ e $X=\alpha Y^{1/\beta}$

Para $r>-1$:
$$
E(X^r)=\alpha^r E\left(Y^{r/\beta}\right)
=\alpha^r\Gamma\left(1+\frac{r}{\beta}\right)
$$

Em particular:
$$
\boxed{E(X)=\alpha\Gamma\left(1+\frac{1}{\beta}\right)}
$$
e
$$
E(X^2)=\alpha^2\Gamma\left(1+\frac{2}{\beta}\right)
\quad\Rightarrow\quad
\boxed{\mathrm{Var}(X)=\alpha^2\left[\Gamma\left(1+\frac{2}{\beta}\right)-\Gamma^2\left(1+\frac{1}{\beta}\right)\right]}
$$
